Class CardEffectManager

java.lang.Object
org.example.eiscuno.model.card.effects.CardEffectManager
public class CardEffectManager extends Object
Manages special card effects in the UNO game. Follows the Open/Closed Principle: new effects can be added without modifying existing code. This manager delegates the effect execution to registered implementations of ICardEffect.
Since:
version 3.0
Version:
2.0
Author:
Juan Moreno.
See Also:

  • Constructor Details

    • CardEffectManager

      public CardEffectManager()
      Constructs the effect manager and registers all built-in special effects.

  • Method Details

    • registerEffect

      public void registerEffect(ICardEffect effect)
      Registers a new card effect. This allows the system to be extended with additional effects without modifying the manager.
      Parameters:
      effect - the effect to register.
      See Also:
      • ICardEffect

    • applyCardEffect

      public void applyCardEffect(GameUno gameUno, Card card, Player currentPlayer, Player opponent)
      Applies the special effect of a played card, if applicable. Only the first applicable effect (based on ICardEffect.canApply(Card)) is applied.
      Parameters:
      gameUno - the current game instance
      card - the card that was played
      currentPlayer - the player who played the card
      opponent - the opponent affected by the effect

    • hasSpecialEffect

      public boolean hasSpecialEffect(Card card)
      Checks if the given card has any special effect registered.
      Parameters:
      card - the card to check
      Returns:
      True if a special effect can be applied to the card; false otherwise
